description:
Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act (1990) (as amended) for a minor-material amendment to Condition 61 (in respect of Plot A01 Phase 3) of the Outline Planning Permission 2011/1815 (as amended) dated 30th of March 2012 for the - demolition of all existing buildings and construction of a mixed use redevelopment to provide residential units, including affordable housing, retail, financial and professional services, caf�/restaurant, bar and hot food takeaway uses, car showrooms, office floorspace and flexible workspace, a hotel, community uses and assembly and leisure uses, associated basement and ground level parking and servicing; energy centres; new vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation; and new public amenity space and landscaping including part of the 'Linear Park'. 
Proposal seeks amendments to the consented Parameter Plans and Development Specification Document as they relate to Plot A01 (Phase 3) of the outline consent.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This development shall be begun within 5 years from the date of this permission.

Reason: to comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - This permission shall lapse unless the first Reserved Matters application is made within five years of the date of the original permission ref 2011/1815. 

Reason: to comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 3 - Approval of details of the following reserved matters shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in respect of the Outline Component of the Planning Application (as set out on parameter plan PA_03_000 specified in this schedule) of the development:-
the scale of the buildings and structures 
the layout of the buildings, routes and structures
access to and within the site for vehicles, cycles and pedestrians
the external appearance of the buildings and structures, including facing materials
landscaping of private and public space

Reason: To comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.  Planning policy will evolve throughout the development and the reserved matters applications should take account of this.
Condition : 4 - Approval of the Reserved Matters referred to in Condition 03 shall be obtained from the local planning authority in writing prior to the commencement of any development to which those Reserved Matters relate and the development shall be carried out only as approved.

Reason: to comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 5 - No later than 8 years following the date of the original permission 2011/1815 dated 30th March 2012 application or applications shall have been submitted to the local planning authority for the approval of Reserved Matters in respect to all of the built accommodation herby permitted.

Reason: to comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 6 - No Reserved Matters approval shall be implemented more than 10 years from the date of the original, ref 2011/1815 dated 30th March 2012, or 2 years from the date of the final approval of any Reserved Matters application, whichever is later.

Reason: to comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. 
Condition : 7 - None of the works which are subject of the details required in condition 03 shall be commenced without the prior approval of those details by the local planning authority.

Reason: in order that the local planning authority may be satisfied as to the details of the development.
Condition : 8 - The details submitted in relation to condition 03 shall be in accordance with the elements in the Design Principles Documents Part 1 and 2 identified in this schedule, and any subsequent reviews and updates to these documents, identified as mandatory within the documents unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To control the appearance and architectural form of the development and to ensure a high quality and co-ordinated design for the built form, in accordance with policy IS3 of the Core Strategy and policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document.
Condition : 9 - The details submitted in relation to condition 03 shall be in accordance with the scale and massing limitations set by the submitted parameter plans specified in this schedule.

Reason: The merits and environmental impacts of the proposed development have been assessed in relation to the form of development shown on the submitted parameter plans.  In order to ensure the development proceeds on the basis of the scheme on which an Environmental Impact Assessment has been undertaken, the permission needs to be substantially tied to the details assessed, and to allow the Local Planning Authority to review any potential changes to the scheme in accordance with policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document.
Condition : 10 - The total gross external floorspace areas of the uses hereby approved shall be limited to the following:
(a) Overall gross external floorspace of all the uses, including parking, servicing, plant and storage, shall not exceed 263,030 sq.m. GEA (including 18,571sq.m. GEA in basements);
(b) Retail and professional and financial services (Classes A1/A2) uses shall not exceed 3,917sq.m. GEA;
(c) Food and drink uses (Classes A3/A4/A5) shall not exceed 3917sq.m. GEA;
(d) Car Showroom uses (Sui Generis) shall not exceed 1,886sq.m. GEA;
(e) Assembly and leisure (Class D2) uses shall not exceed 1,392sq.m. GEA. Community and assembly and leisure uses (Class D1/D2) shall be at least 750sq.m. GEA; 
(f) Business (Class B1) uses shall not exceed 49,159sq.m. GEA in the event that Plot A01 is provided within the development as business (Class B1 use) and 20,450sq.m. GEA in the event that Plot A01 is provided within the development as residential (Class C3) use;
(g) Hotel (Class C1) use shall not exceed 10,400sq.m. GEA;
(h) Serviced apartments (Class C1) use shall not exceed 6,050sq.m. GEA; 
(i) Residential (Class C3) use shall not exceed 192,825sq.m. GEA in the event that the serviced apartments mentioned at (h) are provided within the development as Use Class C3 and 188,007 sq.m. GEA in the event that the serviced apartments mentioned at (h) are provided as Use Class C1;)

Reason: to restrict the floorspace of the various uses to the levels proposed and assessed, and to ensure a suitable mix of uses within the development.
Condition : 11 - Subject to further restriction by other conditions attached to this planning permission, the maximum floorspace area in each Plot shall not exceed that set out in Schedule 1A, 2A and 2B in Appendix A of the Revised Development Specification specified in this schedule

Reason: to restrict the levels of floorspace of the various uses within the development to the Plot proposed to ensure a suitable mix, balance and distribution of uses throughout the development.
Condition : 12 - The distribution of uses within each Plot shall be in accordance with the parameter plans hereby approved. 

Reason: the impacts and the suitability of the various uses within the proposed development have been assessed in relation to their distribution across the site, as shown on the submitted parameter plans.  In order to ensure the development proceeds on the basis of the scheme on which the assessment has been undertaken, the permission needs to be substantially tied to the details assessed, and to allow the Local Planning Authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
Condition : 13 - The residential (Class C3) accommodation hereby approved (excluding that within the Detailed Component of the Planning Application as identified on parameter plan PA_03_000) shall not exceed 1339 units if Plot A01 is provided within the development as residential (C3) floorspace and shall not exceed 1079 units if Plot A01 is provided within the development as business (B1) floorspace.

Reason: To control the number of residential units, to accord with the planning application, and to accord substantially with the number and mix of units set out in the Environmental Statement dated April 2011 and its Addendum dated October 2011 and Annexes dated January 2012, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS5.
Condition : 14 - The private residential accommodation in the Outline Component of the Planning Application (as set out on parameter plan PA_03_000 specified in this schedule) shall include a mix of sizes in accordance with the following mix, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority:
Studio units: 		                0 to 6 %
1 bedroom units: 		13-18%
2 bedroom units:		68-74%
3 + bedroom units:	             8-12%

Reason: To replicate the unit mix of the residential accommodation to that assessed and, in general accordance with Core Strategy policy IS5 and DMPD policy DMH3.
Condition : 15 - Unless otherwise approved under 2011/1815, details of the distribution and internal configuration of residential units, including details of gardens and amenity space, shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval in association with the details required under condition 03. The details shall show how policy and supplementary guidance in effect at the time of the reserved matters approvals will be met.  All units shall be to Lifetime Homes standards and not less than 10% shall be wheelchair accessible or easily adaptable for wheelchair users. The development shall not be implemented otherwise than in accordance with those details as may be approved unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved by the Council.

Reason: To ensure satisfactory residential accommodation is provided, including for people with disabilities, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS5 and DMPD policies DMH4, DMH6 and DMH7.
Condition : 16 - The Detailed Component of the Planning Application (as set out on parameter plan PA_03_000 specified in this schedule) shall be implemented in accordance with the plans specified in this schedule unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
Condition : 17 - The landscape works and planting as may be approved pursuant to condition 03 shall be carried in accordance with a programme to be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to commencement of development of the Outline Planning Application.

Reason: in order that the landscaping is provided in co-ordination with the remainder of the development and to an appropriate timetable so that the areas of amenity space and public realm are provided in a timely fashion for the benefit of residents and the public.
Condition : 18 - The car parking and motorcycle parking provided on the site shall be in accordance with the details specified in tables 7 and 8 of the Revised Development Specification specified in this Schedule.

Reason: To avoid creating unacceptable traffic congestion on the surrounding road network and ensure there would be adequate parking and servicing for the development and no adverse transport impacts from the development in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1 and DMPD policies DMT1 and DMT2.
Condition : 19 - The cycle parking levels provided on the site shall, as a minimum, be in accordance with the details specified in tables 7 and 8 of the Revised Development Specification specified in this schedule.

Reason: To ensure an appropriate level of cycle parking is provided in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1.
Condition : 20 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, details of Parking Management Strategy and Car Park Management Plan for Phase 1 shall be implemented in accordance with details approved under ref. 2014/5745 dated 10/03/2015.  A Parking Management Strategy and Car Park Management Plan for Phases 2 and 3 shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval prior to commencement of the use of the parking areas within each Plot.  This shall provide an overarching strategy for car park management for each Phase including: pricing structure, means of separating public, operational and residential parking and enforcing that separation; allocation of residential spaces between market and affordable units; allocation of parking for people with disabilities; car club allocation; charging points for electric vehicles; cycle parking/storage differentiated by residential, public and other users; access controls to car parks; access controls to emergency vehicle routes; handling the relationship between private and service vehicles; a full delivery and servicing strategy for each Plot.  The development shall not be operated otherwise than in accordance with the Parking Management Strategy and Car Park Management Plan as may be approved.

Reason: To ensure appropriate levels of parking are provided and adequate servicing arrangements and vehicle access, in line with council policy DMT2.
Condition : 21 - The highway layout identified on Plan LL405_D_SP_004 Revision H shall be implemented and managed thereafter in accordance with the details approved under ref.2013/0665 dated 11/7/2014, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority. 

Reason: to ensure adequate access and servicing is maintained to the site and neighbouring sites in accordance with DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 22 - A minimum of 10% of all the car parking spaces and 4% of all the non residential parking spaces hereby approved shall be suitable for the use of wheelchair users and shall be provided in accordance with the details as may be approved under condition 16.  The spaces shall be permanently retained for persons with mobility disabilities.

Reason: To ensure that adequate parking facilities for people with disabilities are provided and retained on site, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1 and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 23 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, details of electric vehicle parking spaces for Phase 1 shall be implemented in accordance with details approved under ref. 2012/4481 dated 2/11/2011 and 2013/5711 dated 17/03/14 for phase 1, and 2013/5259 dated 12/09/14. Details of Electric Vehicle Car Parking spaces   for Phase3 shall  be submitted to the local planning authority for approval in connection with the reserved matters to be submitted under condition 03. Such details shall include provision of at least 20% active and 20% passive provision for all residential parking spaces and 10% active and 10% passive provision for all commercial uses.  Such details as may be approved shall be implemented prior to use of the car parking areas and retained in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure that adequate electric vehicle parking spaces are delivered and retained on site in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan.
Condition : 24 - Details of ground level cycle parking, including details of the cycle hire schemes to be implemented on the development site, including design, position, size, number of Cycle Hire Scheme docking stations and method of implementation, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement above ground works of the Detailed and Outline Elements of the Planning Application.

Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development and to ensure an appropriate level of cycle parking is provided in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1 and DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 25 - (a): The net sales area of the retail unit in Plot A09 shall not exceed 1,675sqm.
(b): Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) (or any Order revoking or re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no more than 20% of the net sales area of the retail unit in Plot A09 shall be used for the sale of comparison goods, and the remainder shall be used for convenience goods.

Reason: In permitting the quantum of floorspace in the foodstore the Council has had regard to the potential impact on other centres and would wish to reassess that impact of including more large units in the scheme in accordance with Core Strategy policy PL8 and DMPD policies DMTS1 and DMTS2.
Condition : 26 - Other than the foodstore identified in Plot A09 and unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority on an application made pursuant to this condition, no individual Class A1, A2, A3, A4 or A5 unit shall exceed 300sq.m. net sales area 

Reason: To prevent large out-of-centre commercial units in accordance with Council policy DMTS2.
Condition : 27 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Permitted Development Order 1995, or any replacement Order, no Class A2, A3, A4 or A5 floorspace implemented pursuant to this planning permission shall be used for Class A1 purposes.

Reason: To ensure an A1 use is not implemented without prior consideration by the local planning authority in line with policy DMT2.
Condition : 28 - No A1, A2, A3, A4 or A5 unit that may be implemented subject to this planning permission shall be combined with an adjoining unit of the same use class without prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent amalgamation of small units to create large out-of-centre units in line with policy DMTS2.
Condition : 29 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, details of the caf� to Plot A09 shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under ref: 2015/4747 dated 14/10/2015. For any subsequent phases details of the amount and spatial distribution of, and differentiation between Class A1, A2, A3, A4 and A5 uses within the areas shown to accommodate such uses in the Detailed and Outline Component of the Planning Permission in the parameter plans hereby approved, including details of size, location, fa�ade treatment and proposed forecourts, disabled access and toilets for each unit, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing prior to the first occupation of each unit.  The uses shall only be operated in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authoring.

Reason: To ensure a suitable mix of uses within the development, in the interests of the appearance of the development and to ensure satisfactory access for people with disabilities in accordance with Council policies DMTS2, DMTS8 and DMS1.
Condition : 30 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, external ventilation equipment, including ducting, for Phase 1 shall be implemented in accordance with details approved under ref. 2013/5710 dated 20 December 2013 and for Phases 2 and 3, and any uses other than car show room, or A2 uses in Plot A10 details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to installation.

Reason: in the interests of local amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS3.
Condition : 31 - The Class A3, A4 and A5 premises shall not be open to customers other than between 0700 and 2330, unless otherwise approved by the local planning authority in respect of any individually defined unit pursuant to this condition.

Reason: to safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood and local residents, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 32 - The B1 or A2 uses hereby approved shall not include use in connection with the hiring, distribution of or trading in motor vehicles, or in connection with driving instruction.

Reason: appropriate parking and service facilities are not provided for such uses in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1 and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 33 - Details of the Car Showroom uses, including details of size, location, fa�ade treatment and proposed forecourts, disabled access and toilets for each unit, and delivery and servicing (which for the avoidance of doubt shall not be from Nine Elms Lane), shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing prior to the first occupation of each unit.  The uses shall only be operated in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority. 

Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development, to ensure appropriate servicing for the use and to protect the operation of the TLRN, operation of bus services and pedestrian and cycle route and to ensure satisfactory access for people with disabilities in accordance with Council policies DMTS8, DMT2 and DMS1.
Condition : 34 - Unless otherwise approved under 2011/1815, sustainability and energy strategies for Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with details approved under ref: 2013/2594 dated 30 June 2014. Prior to the commencement of Phases 2 and 3 details of sustainability and energy strategies shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.  These details shall include: BREEAM, Code for Sustainable Homes, passive design measures, energy efficiency, and renewable technologies, and shall be informed by and accompanied by the District Heating Network Statement required to be submitted prior to the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development in line with the S106 attached to this planning permission.  The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the sustainability and energy strategy approved by the Council.

Reason: to ensure the implementation of sustainable design, low carbon development and renewable energy in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS2 and DMPD policy DMS3.
Condition : 35 - Unless otherwise approved under 2011/1815, sustainability and energy strategies for Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with details approved under ref: 2014/5602 dated 23/01/2015.  For any subsequent phases 
a) Prior to first occupation of the uses hereby permitted, a Code for Sustainable Homes pre-assessment and a BREEAM pre-assessment (or other verification process agreed with the Local Planning Authority) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, confirming that it is anticipated that the agreed minimum standard at Code for Sustainable Homes Level 3 and BREEAM 'very good' will be met.
(b) Within 3 months following first occupation of the uses hereby permitted, a Code for Sustainable Homes final certification and a BREEAM final certification (or other verification process agreed with the Local Planning Authority) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, confirming that the agreed minimum standards at Code for Sustainable Homes Level 3 and BREEAM 'Very Good' have been met.

Reason: To ensure the implementation of sustainable design, low carbon development and renewable energy in line with Core Strategy policy IS2 and DMPD policy DMS3.
Condition : 36 - Details of a sustainable waste strategy for each relevant phase of the Outline Component of the Planning Application shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in association with the details required under condition 03.  The sustainable waste strategy shall be informed by and accompanied by the feasibility study to be submitted to the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development in line with the S106 attached to this planning permission.  The development shall be implemented in accordance with those details approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: to mitigate the quantity of waste arising from the operation of the development, ensure appropriate provision is made for storage and disposal, and to minimise the environmental impacts from that waste in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 37 - Unless otherwise approved under 2011/1815, sustainable waste strategies for Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under ref.2012/5876 dated 20th June 2014. Details of a sustainable waste strategy for the Detailed Component of the Planning Application shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to commencement of development; the strategy shall include details of covenants to be attached to leases to ensure that appropriate refuse collection arrangements remain in place.  If the development is not commenced within 18 months of the date of this permission the sustainable waste strategy shall be informed by and accompanied by the feasibility study to be submitted to the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development in line with the S106 attached to this planning permission.  The development shall be implemented in accordance with those details approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: to mitigate the quantity of waste arising from the operation of the development, ensure appropriate provision is made for storage and disposal, and to minimise the environmental impacts from that waste in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 38 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the Construction and Environment Management Plan approved under ref: 2012/5802 dated 11/02/2013 and 2013/1897 dated 25/06/13. For Phases 2 and 3 no development shall commence on site until a Construction and Environmental Management Plan has been submitted to and been approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The construction management plan shall then be reviewed and updated prior to commencement of each Plot, to take particular account of new residents within the development, and an amended version submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to commencement of that Plot unless it is agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority that no amended version is warranted.  The construction management plan shall include specific details for:-
a) the control of noise and vibration during hours of noisy activities; 
b) a waste and material management, transportation and disposal strategy, including delivery booking and vehicle holding arrangements, and targets and arrangements for maximising the use of the river for 'muck away' and material delivery where feasible;
c) air quality measures for the control and monitoring of dust, fine particles and odours;
d)construction traffic routing through the area and the development site and an enforcement system for breach of its provisions;
e) a low emission strategy for construction traffic and machinery;
f) piling or other penetrative methods of foundation design in relation to risks to underlying groundwater
g) measures to protect controlled waters
h) measures to minimise cross contamination on site
i) measures to deal with unexpected contamination on site
j) details of security of the construction site in relation to adjacent sites.
The development shall not be undertaken otherwise than in accordance with the approved construction and environment management plan un
Condition : 39 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Phases 1 and 2 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the detailed scheme of archaeological investigation approved under ref: 2012/4481 dated 2/11/2012 and 2015/0175 dated 13/02/2015. For any subsequent phases, development shall not commence   until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme for investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The detailed proposals should be in the form of an archaeological project design and should be in accordance with appropriate English Heritage guidelines.  The development shall only take place in accordance with detailed scheme pursuant to this condition.  The archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the local planning authority.

Reason: in order that archaeological remains that may exist on the site can be investigated, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS2.
Condition : 40 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, noise insulation measures for Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with details approved under ref 2012/5625 dated 19/8/2013 and ref 2013/5607 dated 18/7/2014 and Phase 2 in accordance with details approved under 2015/5230 dated 6/11/2015. For subsequent phases of the development details of a scheme to protect the residential accommodation hereby approved from external noise sources, including details of fenestration, and balustrade and screen design to balconies and winter gardens, and details of ventilation, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval for the Detailed Component of the Planning Application prior to the commencement of development and for each phase of the Outline Component of the Planning Application with the details required under condition 03.  The scheme as may be approved shall be fully implemented prior to occupation of the residential accommodation to which it relates.

Reason: to protect the occupiers or the residential buildings in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS4 and DMPD policy DMH4 (ii) and to ensure no conflict of use arises with nearby safeguarded wharves in accordance with Council policy PL9.
Condition : 41 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance the low emission strategy approved under ref 2014/4605 dated 16/09/2014.  For any subsequent phases a Low Emission Strategy relating to the development following occupation shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to the occupation of the development.  The development shall be operated in accordance with the Low Emission Strategy as may be approved.

Reason: To ensure the implementation of a low carbon development in line with Council policy IS2.
Condition : 42 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance the details to protect residential accommodation from air pollutants approved under ref 2013/4921 dated 17/3/2014 and 2012/5625 dated 19/08/2013. For Phases 2 and 3 details of a scheme to protect the residential accommodation hereby approved from external high concentrations of air pollutants shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval for the Detailed Component of the Planning Application prior to the commencement of development and for each phase of the Outline Component of the Planning Application with the details required under condition 03.  The scheme approved by the local planning authority shall be fully implemented prior to occupation of the residential accommodation to which it relates.

Reason: to protect the occupiers or the residential buildings in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS4 and DMPD policy DMH4 (ii) and to ensure no conflict of use arises with nearby safeguarded wharves in accordance with Council policy PL9.
Condition : 43 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the land and groundwater remediation strategies approved under the following references 2012/4481 dated 2/11/12, 2013/0341 dated 17/4/2013, 2015/5024 dated 9/10/2015 and 2015/0454 dated 4/02/2015 and Part Discharge for Phase 2 under ref: 2015/4829 dated 9/10/2015 . For any subsequent phases a site investigation shall be undertaken for land and groundwater contamination that fully categorises site conditions and assesses risks over the full extent of the site area.  The assessment shall be based on the residential use of the developed site.  A report detailing the investigation results and risk assessment shall be submitted for the approval of the Council.  If the assessment indicates that there may be unacceptable risks to future users and/or controlled water, then a remediation strategy that addresses these risks shall be submitted for approval by the council.    The approved scheme of remediation and/or mitigation shall be implemented as part of the redevelopment of the site and, following its completion, verification that the remediation has been achieved shall be provided to the Council in a report. Prior to first occupation of all plots an Interim Verification Report (including verification that underground services around block A09 have been constructed to the agreed specification) demonstrating the measures to protect human health have been implemented, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Within six months following first occupation of each plot, a final verification report demonstrating the agreed remediation has been achieved and the final landscaping scheme is in place, shall be submitted to the Council.

Reason: To prevent any pollution in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS4.
Condition : 44 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Phase 1 (Plots A10 and A11) of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the flood management plan approved under ref.2013/5710 dated 20/12/2013. The development permitted by this planning permission shall only be carried out in accordance with the approved Flood Risk Assessment (FRA) (dated April 2011, ref: C11381 ES 602) and the following mitigation measures detailed within the FRA: 1.All sleeping accommodation within residential and hotel uses are to be set above the 1 in 200 year flood level as derived through breach analysis. The Finished Floor Levels shall be set in accordance with the FRA table 2.; 2. A flood management plan shall be produced and submitted to the LPA in accordance with the FRA recommendations for approval and implemented only as approved, this should include details of updating annually and ongoing management together with identification and provision of safe route(s)  or safe refuge areas within the buildings for occupants to use during times of flood; 3.Basement energy centres shall be fully tanked to prevent any water ingress and ensure the buildings remain operational during times of flood.

Reason: To comply with the Exceptions Test and to minimise the risk of internal flooding and to ensure the safety of occupants during a flood, to ensure users of the site are aware of how to act during times of flood to minimise risk and to ensure no additional burden on the emergency services, and to prevent the services to the building being cut off during a flood and to reduce the risk of flooding to the proposed development and future occupants, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS5.
Condition : 45 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the detailed surface water drainage scheme approved under ref.2012/4481 dated 2/11/2012 . Prior to commencement of any subsequent phases of the development, a detailed surface water drainage scheme shall be submitted including the SUDS features set out in the Flood Risk Assessment (dated April 2011, ref: C11381 ES 602) such as balancing ponds, green roofs, permeable paving and storage tanks and approved in writing by the local planning authority and implemented in accordance with such details.

Reason: To ensure a sustainable drainage system is implemented and to minimise the risk of flooding from the drainage system and to prevent the increased risk of flooding, to improve and protect water quality and to improve habitat and amenity in accordance with Council policies DMS5 and DMS6.
Condition : 46 - No infiltration of surface water drainage into the ground is permitted other than with the express written consent of the Local Planning Authority, which may be given for those parts of the site where it has been demonstrated that there is no resultant unacceptable risk to Controlled Waters. 

Reason: The Environment Agency actively encourages the use of Sustainable Urban Drainage Systems (SUDS) at new developments and to ensure the implementation of such schemes in accordance with Council Policy DMS6.
Condition : 47 - An Accessibility Management Plan which sets out how at least 10% of the hotel rooms provided would be wheelchair accessible and how continuing management of the hotel will ensure accessible rooms are maintained and managed should be provided to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to the occupation of the hotel.  Such details as may be approved shall be implemented.

Reason: to ensure appropriate facilities and access for people with disabilities in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 48 - A Cultural Strategy in line with the Nine Elms Cultural Principles document approved by the Strategy Board and informed through discussions with Wandsworth Arts, Planning And Economic Development Services, shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval prior to commencement of above ground works of the relevant phase, to include an overarching cultural strategy for the site, including how art work will be integrated into the landscaping of the development.  The details as may be approved shall be implemented in line with a programme agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: in the interests of the visual amenity of the development and quality of the environment in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 49 - Details of taxi parking and service areas for each relevant phase of the Outline component of the planning application, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in association with the details required by condition 03.  The provision approved by the local planning authority shall be provided and permanently retained for the prescribed uses.

Reason: to ensure appropriate facilities are provided and retained on site, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1 and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 50 - Full details of the operation and management of the proposed serviced apartments shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority in association with the details required by condition 03.  the serviced apartments shall be operated and managed in lien with such details as may be approved unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority

Reason: the serviced apartments have been applied for as either C1 or C3 floorspace as the management structure of the units is yet to be confirmed.  To ensure the management of these units, and therefore their appropriate use class is established appropriate management structures delivered.
Condition : 51 - A minimum of 16,500sq.m. of business (Class B1) floorspace should be provided within Phase 2 .

Reason: to ensure delivery of office provision within the Vauxhall Embassy district of Nine Elms in line with council policy DMTS13.
Condition : 52 - A minimum of 750sq.m. of community (D1/D2) floorspace should be provided within Plot A05 of Phase 2

Reason: to ensure the provision of necessary infrastructure to support the development in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS6.
Condition : 53 - The window glass of the shop fronts hereby approved shall not be mirrored, painted or otherwise obscured unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. No shelving, cabinets or other such obstruction shall be placed at any time within 1m of the shop windows fronting Nine Elms lane and/or Ponton Road unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: In order to prevent the creation of a dead frontage and to ensure an appropriate the character and appearance of the streetscene, in accordance with policy DMTS8 and DMS1 of the DMPD submission version.
Condition : 54 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, the balustrade to the communal amenity area of Plot A10 shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under ref: 2013/5699 dated 17/3/2014 prior to occupation of any residential unit in this plot.

Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development and to ensure a reasonable noise environment within the outdoor amenity area for this Plot in accordance with council policies DMS1 and DMH4 of the DMPD.
Condition : 55 - Details of any outside forecourt/outdoor space associated with any of the commercial uses hereby approved are to be submitted to the local planning authority for approval, including details of location, hours of use and any boundary treatment (temporary or permanent).  The forecourt/outdoor spaces shall not be implemented other than in line with those details approved by the local planning authority.

Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development, the amenity of neighbouring residential properties and to ensure there is no street clutter in line with council policies DMS1, appearance and amenity and ensure not impact pedestrian/cycle movement.
Condition : 56 - Details of landscaping and treatment of parts of the site not covered by buildings within Phase 1, including details of habitat creation, a landscape management plan, external lighting, and species of new planting, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of above ground works  and such details as may be approved shall be carried out in accordance with a programme to be agreed in writing with the local planning authority.

Reason: to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the development and ensure protection of wildlife and supporting habitat and secure opportunities for enhancement of the nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with Council policies DMS1 and DMO4.
Condition : 57 - Prior to occupation of the residential units in Phase 1, the boundary treatment to the private communal gardens and private gardens shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under ref: 2013/6004 dated 18/7/2014. 
Details of the private communal gardens and private gardens for any subsequent phase of the development shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval.  Such details approved by the local planning authority shall be implemented prior to the occupation of each Plot.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance and to protect the privacy of future occupiers and to accord with council policy DMS1.
Condition : 58 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the details of the external materials approved under ref. 2013/2051 dated 26/7/13, 2013/2827 dated 19/12/13 and amended by 2014/1016 dated 18/3/2014 and for Phase 2 approved under ref. 2015/4626 dated 20/10/2015. For any subsequent phases of the development, notwithstanding any material specified in the application, details and samples of materials proposed to be used on all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority within three months subsequent to the commencement of development.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved materials

Reason: in order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials, in the interests of the appearance on the locality, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.
Condition : 59 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Phase 1 (Block A09) and Phase 2 (Blocks A03,A04 and A05) of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the details of noise insulation  approved under ref. 2013/5699 dated 17/03/2014 and 2015/5230 dated 6/11/15. For any subsequent phase prior to the commencement of the A3, A4 or D1 uses details of noise insulation measures to provide effective resistance to the transmission of airborne and impact sound between any A3, A4 and D1 uses and any residential uses (C3) shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved measures shall be implemented prior to the commencement of the A3, A4 or D1 uses. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with Council policy DMH4.
Condition : 60 - Before occupation of each unit of the flexible commercial floorspace (A1, A2, A3, A4 & D1) details of the size, location, fa�ade treatment and proposed forecourts, disabled access and toilets for each unit shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The uses shall only be operated in accordance with the details approved by the local planning authority in writing and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a suitable mix of uses within the development, in the interests of the appearance of the development and to ensure satisfactory access for people with disabilities in accordance with council policies DMTS2, DMTS8 & DMS1.
Condition : 61 - The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings and documents listed in this schedule.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the Local Planning Authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 62 - Prior to commencement of development of the additional eight units in Phase 1 Plots A10 and A11, the following details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and implemented in accordance with the approved details: (i) cycle parking (ii) refuse storage (iii) design and external appearance of balconies (iv) facing materials (v) noise insulation (vi) fa�ade treatment/design to the north and south elevations Plot A10.  

Reason: To ensure an appropriate level of cycle parking, a high-quality design and to ensure adequate living conditions for future occupiers in accordance with Core Strategy IS1 and DMPD Policy DMS1.
Condition : 63 - The first-floor finished floor level must be set no lower than 5.27 metres above Ordnance Datum (m A.O.D), in line with the submitted Flood Risk Assessment by RPS dated 15 October 2021; ref HLEF 81726, version 1.

Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding to the development and occupants and provide suitable living accommodation for suture occupiers in accordance with NPPF 2021, the London Plan Policies SI12 and Local Plan Policies PL2 and DMS5.
Condition : 64 - Prior to first occupation of Plot A01 (residential option), a Flood Management Plan and Emergency Response Plan shall be produced and submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. This shall include, but not limited to the identification and provision of safe route(s) or safe refuge areas within the buildings for occupants to use during official times of flood and the ongoing management of flood management measures. The plan shall be implemented as approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure the safety of occupants during a flood, to ensure users of the site are aware of how to act during times of flood to minimise risk and to ensure no additional burden on the emergency services, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS5 and to ensure accordance with the Flood and Water Management Act 2010).
Condition : 65 - No part of the basement or ground floor of Plot A01 (Residential Option) shall be used for habitable accommodation, which would also include use as a residential lounge, cinema or gym at basement level. 

Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding to the development and occupants and provide suitable living accommodation for suture occupiers in accordance with NPPF 2021, the London Plan Policies SI12 and Local Plan Policies PL2 and DMS5.
